docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, June 13 -- The United Nations Subcommission on Freedom of Information and the Press decided today, by a vote of 5 to 4, to consider a memorandum from the International Federation of Free Journalists of Central and Eastern Europe and the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, June 13 -- The United Nations Subcommission on Freedom of Information and the Press decided today, by a vote of 5 to 4, to consider a memorandum from the International Federation of Free Journalists of Central and Eastern Europe and the Baltic and Balkan countries, and to decide tomorrow whether or not to give an oral hearing to the organization's representative.
docs.abstract: subcomm votes to consider E Eur group memo over Zonov and Dedijer and Yugoslav objections; Chile proposes comm to study obstacles to free press

headline.main: U. N. Body on Press Votes to Receive Note From 'Free' Eastern European Journalists

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 13 -- The Senate ratified the international wheat agreement today. It acted by voice vote after several members, including Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg, Republican, of Michigan, expressed misgivings about it.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 13 -- The Senate ratified the international wheat agreement today. It acted by voice vote after several members, including Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg, Republican, of Michigan, expressed misgivings about it.
docs.abstract: pact ratified by US Sen; backed by Sen E D Thomas; opposed by Sens Vandenberg and Butler; Lodge dubious

headline.main: Senate Ratifies Wheat Agreement; Vandenberg Holds Misgivings on It; WHEAT AGREEMENT RATIFIED BY SENATE

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 14 -- Ellis O. Briggs, now Ambassador to Uruguay, will succeed Joseph E. Jacobs as Ambassador to Czechoslovakia, the White House announced today. Christian M. Ravndal will succeed Mr. Briggs as Ambassador to Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 14 -- Ellis O. Briggs, now Ambassador to Uruguay, will succeed Joseph E. Jacobs as Ambassador to Czechoslovakia, the White House announced today. Christian M. Ravndal will succeed Mr. Briggs as Ambassador to Uruguay.

headline.main: Jacobs, Envoy to Prague Since October, Resigns, and Truman Names E. O. Briggs

docs.snippet: Plans for holding the first inter-American conference of advertising groups early next year in Montevideo, Uruguay, were announced yesterday at the Advertising Club of New York.

docs.snippet: ROME, June 18 (AP) -- Italian emigration officials have requested $32,000,000 from Italy's European Recovery Program funds to be spent in South America.
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME, June 18 (AP) -- Italian emigration officials have requested $32,000,000 from Italy's European Recovery Program funds to be spent in South America.
